title: Can, Could Or Be Able To

questions.question: This game ……………… be played by two people.
questions.description: Be able to is not normally used in passive structures.

questions.question: How many mangoes ………………. get?
questions.description: We do not normally use could to say that somebody managed to do something on one occasion.

questions.question: She …………… speak six languages.
questions.description: Be able to often has the same meaning as can.

questions.question: Chennai …………….. be very warm in summer.
questions.description: We often use ‘can’ to say what is common or typical.

questions.question: I ………………. so I didn’t go in for the race.
I …………….. the race if I tried.
questions.description: We can use could have + past participle to talk about hypothetical situations.

questions.question: I ………………… understand what you want.
questions.description: Be able to often has the same meaning as can.

questions.question: One day, I ………………… afford a home and a car.
questions.description: Can is not grammatically possible in future tenses.

questions.question: I might ……………….. come.
questions.description: Can and could are not possible after modal auxiliary verbs.

questions.question: ……………… I ask you something if you are not too busy?
You ………………. borrow my car if you asked.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would / could + infinitive in the main clause.
